theorem P1_union {X : Type*} [TopologicalSpace X] {A B : Set X} :
    Topology.P1 (A : Set X) → Topology.P1 (B : Set X) → Topology.P1 (A ∪ B) := by
  intro hA hB
  dsimp [Topology.P1] at hA hB ⊢
  -- `closure (interior A)` is contained in `closure (interior (A ∪ B))`
  have hA_closure :
      closure (interior A) ⊆ closure (interior (A ∪ B)) := by
    apply closure_mono
    exact interior_mono (by
      intro x hx
      exact Or.inl (show x ∈ (A : Set X) by
        have : x ∈ interior A := hx
        exact (interior_subset : interior A ⊆ A) hx))
  -- `closure (interior B)` is contained in `closure (interior (A ∪ B))`
  have hB_closure :
      closure (interior B) ⊆ closure (interior (A ∪ B)) := by
    apply closure_mono
    exact interior_mono (by
      intro x hx
      exact Or.inr (show x ∈ (B : Set X) by
        have : x ∈ interior B := hx
        exact (interior_subset : interior B ⊆ B) hx))
  -- Use the assumptions and the two inclusions above
  have hA' : (A : Set X) ⊆ closure (interior (A ∪ B)) := hA.trans hA_closure
  have hB' : (B : Set X) ⊆ closure (interior (A ∪ B)) := hB.trans hB_closure
  -- Combine the two inclusions to get the desired one for `A ∪ B`
  intro x hx
  cases hx with
  | inl hxA => exact hA' hxA
  | inr hxB => exact hB' hxB

theorem P2_implies_closure_interior_eq_closure {X : Type*} [TopologicalSpace X] {A : Set X} :
    Topology.P2 (A : Set X) → closure (interior A) = closure A := by
  intro hP2
  -- First, derive P1 from P2
  have hP1 : Topology.P1 (A : Set X) := Topology.P2_implies_P1 hP2
  -- Use the equivalence established for P1
  exact (Topology.P1_iff_closure_interior_eq_closure (A := A)).1 hP1
